oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview - Ronnie Pugh - 1999-09-06
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with Ernest Tubb biographer Ronnie Pugh by Eddie Stubbs - Date not listed but announced as being held on the 15th anniversary of his death. WSM radio recording.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ronnie Pugh; Eddie Stubbs;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Recording of St. Louis Blues (unaccompanied fiddle) / (03:18) Unidentified recording called Steel Guitar Serenade (possibly Bob Dunn's Vagabonds or Milton Brown and his Musical Brownies) / (06:16) Interview begins in progress with talk about Mack McGar / (07:22) talks about marrying Olene and Tubb's problems with Elaine / (06:14) talk about the Ernest Tubb Record shop and the issue with buying country recordings and mail order sales / (12:39) talk about the Midnight Jamboree radio show sponsored by the Ernest Tubb record shop / (14:03) Tubb's insistence that RCA records reissue Jimmie Rodgers records / (15:14) WSM station break with commercials / (17:22) Plays commercial recording of Letters Have No Arms by Ernest Tubb / (20:45) Talk about Billy Byrd and Red Foley / (22:27) Plays commercial recording of Don't Be Ashamed Of Your Age by Tubb and Foley / (24:32) WSM news break / (27:52) Plays commercial recording of Missing In Action by Ernest Tubb /

(31:20) Ronnie talks about his Tubb biography / (32:05) Talks about the song Missing In Action and other recordings found and recorded by Tubb and his 1950's material / (36:43) Talk about Charlie Walker and plays recording of Fortunes In Memories by Ernest Tubb / (40:14) Hello to Billy Byrd and Dickey Harris / (40:36) Talks about the steel guitar and it's contribution to Tubb's records / (41:36) Talks about Tubb's live band / (42:29) Talks about Tubb's sound / (43:34) WSM station break with commercial / (44:15) Plays recording of Two Glasses Joe by Ernest Tubb / (46:34) More talk on the evolution of Tubb's sound / (47:10) Story about Owen Bradley and his half moon nickname given to him by Tubb / (48:15) Plays recording of Jealous Loving Heart by Ernest Tubb / (50:25) WSM news and weather break / (51:18) TAPE END.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Pugh, Ronnie; Stubbs, Eddie; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
